## environment.yml (Conda)

```{.yaml filename="environment.yml"}
name: project-name
channels:
  - conda-forge
  - defaults
dependencies:
  - python=3.11
  - pandas>=2.0
  - numpy
  - matplotlib
  - seaborn
  - scipy
  - scikit-learn
  - jupyter
  - pip
  - pip:
    - some-pip-only-package
```

## README.md

```{.markdown filename="README.md"}
# Project Name

Brief description of what this project does.

## Setup

### Prerequisites
- [Positron](https://positron.posit.co/) or VS Code
- [Conda](https://github.com/conda-forge/miniforge) (Miniforge recommended)
- [R](https://cran.r-project.org/) (if using R)
- [Git](https://git-scm.com/)

### Installation

1. Clone the repository:
   ```bash
   git clone https://github.com/username/project-name.git
   cd project-name
   ```

2. Create conda environment (Python):
   ```bash
   conda env create -f environment.yml
   conda activate project-name
   ```

3. Install R packages (if using R):
   ```r
   renv::restore()
   ```

## Usage

Describe how to run the analysis:

```bash
# Example
python scripts/run_analysis.py
```

Or:

```r
source("scripts/main.R")
```

## Project Structure

```
project-name/
├── data/
│   ├── raw/          # Original data (read-only)
│   └── processed/    # Cleaned data
├── scripts/          # Analysis scripts
├── output/           # Results and figures
├── environment.yml   # Python dependencies
└── renv.lock        # R dependencies
```

## .claude/CLAUDE.md

```{.markdown filename=".claude/CLAUDE.md"}
# Project: Project Name

## Overview
Brief description of the project and its goals.

## Environment

### Python
```bash
conda activate project-name
```

### R
Uses renv. Activates automatically via `.Rprofile`.

## Key Files and Directories

- `data/raw/` — Original data files (DO NOT MODIFY)
- `data/processed/` — Cleaned/transformed data
- `scripts/` — Analysis scripts
- `output/` — Generated figures and results

## Workflows

### Running the full analysis
```bash
./run_analysis.sh
```

### Generating figures
```r
source("scripts/generate_figures.R")
```

## Data

### Input data
- `data/raw/counts.csv` — Gene expression counts, 20000 genes × 12 samples
- `data/raw/metadata.csv` — Sample metadata

### Output
- `output/results.csv` — Analysis results
- `output/figures/` — Generated figures

## Conventions

- Use tidyverse style for R code
- Use black formatter for Python
- Commit after completing each logical unit of work
- Include Co-Authored-By line in commits

## Notes

Any special instructions or gotchas for this project.
```

## R Script Template

```{.r filename="scripts/analysis.R"}
# =============================================================================
# Script: analysis.R
# Description: Brief description of what this script does
# Author: Your Name
# Date: YYYY-MM-DD
# =============================================================================

# Setup -----------------------------------------------------------------------
library(tidyverse)
library(here)

# Load data -------------------------------------------------------------------
data <- read_csv(here("data/raw/data.csv"))
cat("Loaded", nrow(data), "rows,", ncol(data), "columns\n")
glimpse(data)

# Process data ----------------------------------------------------------------
# Add your analysis here

# Save results ----------------------------------------------------------------
write_csv(results, here("output/results.csv"))
cat("Saved results to output/results.csv\n")

# Session info ----------------------------------------------------------------
sessionInfo()
```
